intro: Beadlea dusenii, commonly known as the Dusen's beadlea, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy inflorescences that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
